##Reflection | when the world gets loud, I'm suddenly very quiet

Micro Signal DeepWorld1

Function introduction, news for the weak voice, observation for the collective direction. Learning for the popularization of science, travel notes for the world. Prose is self-examination, poetry is a tribute to life. As a penguin in the library

In accordance with their years of habit, birthday before the beginning of a year to reflect on their own. I got myself my first birthday present in advance, with seven days left in my 20s.

On December 15th, after seeing Caixin's report, I began to pay attention to the epidemic; on January 18th, after two days of gathering information, I received several reports from the front line, and suddenly became completely panicked. But it was still peaceful at home.

After all, the three generations that have dominated Internet content have not experienced world class catastrophes, and most of them see the world as it is, The Great Leap. Wars are fought in other countries, and all crises are far away.

During the outbreak, these three generations suddenly grew up.

I still had friends and family in Wuhan, and I still have memories in Hubei, and I knew very well that in January China could save a lot of people from itself.

It was a time when China needed brave people more than ever, and I met countless people who were shouting for their lives, who were sacrificing almost everything for the future of others.

Great Grief and an indelible sense of responsibility made a group of people hold up the sky in Hubei.

Each of them is an atom, left which other people can still do so many things, but a few, really willing to leave.

If someone asks you for help, can you really turn a blind eye?

Fortunately, the Chinese people in the world eventually saved the Chinese People's home.

It's just that people overseas at the moment know how bad things are getting abroad.

I chose to surrender today.

First, because their families have been saved, they are turning to foreign aid efforts, but have realized that they can not stop the spread of the epidemic; Second, because overseas countries can only take a series of measures to adapt to their own situation to save themselves.

Most of the country's medical resources were actually consumed by the mainland of China for a long time, and most of the country's governments had to adopt the Singapore model for economic purposes in the early years, the so-called arrogance and ignorance of the West is actually a helpless choice.

China pressed the pause button on the world economy. If they keep their doors closed to each other, perhaps most countries will go on to terrible civil strife. It's not worth it.

I now live in a city that is filled with people every day, and the hustle and bustle of Asians can often mask the restlessness of a shopping spree.

We often refer to those diseases in our discussions, the plagues that each and every one of them could change the course of human civilization.

This outbreak could bring down everything that many countries are proud of, as well as old and rotten institutions.

A feast of the history of Gluttony, the history of each stroke is a short life time Ah.

In the coming year, I would like to do two things, one is to make the products of social psychological support can really help the world; the other is to study hard.

After reading countless materials and interacting with dozens of experts and scholars, I firmly believe that the future of social and psychological problems will develop into an uncontrollable climax; And the degree of attention paid to relevant research and solutions is still very low.

As for the second wish, it was because during the epidemic, for the first time, I found that my abilities were being maximized.

The amount of time and effort I put into this outbreak allowed me to get a sense of what my true social skills were, and the volunteer work showed me how much I could do.

I began to understand that if I study more professional, academic and practical knowledge in the future, I will one day, the explosion of today's power dozens or even hundreds of times.

And in the face of such a catastrophe, I will be able to save many more.

I know it seems like common sense, but it took me 20 years to put a common sense in my heart and practice it.

Someone really lived because of me, said with me a thank you, a sentence you came to live in Wuhan, I have all the words of the food and drink, let me cry into chaos, as if she had only half a home, no children, no husband.

All February I was sending away people I had helped, and one person's relatives were still in the group reporting back for help, when suddenly the news stopped, and a few minutes later, relatives said: "My father has gone, everyone quickly to save others, you still need volunteers? I can always. "

Wuhan is really numb. So many people died, as if some of them couldn't even appear in numbers.

There was a man who was saved, came home to find his family dead, and hanged himself.

How many families don't even have families left.

Some people tell me that what you do is a waste of your time and money.

But I saved a life, a visible, living life! When I started doing all this, I chose to sacrifice many of my own, including the future. Maybe in the big picture I do and do not make a big difference, someone will do it.

But in fact, volunteers are scarce, a volunteer matched seven or eight patients, but also to contact a foundation, materials and hospitals to do donations, we simply too busy.

Wen Liang, Li was so hard on a lot of people that they gave up volunteering when they really needed someone to do the work.

Most retweeters, really, just retweet and superficially assume that this is all there is to it.

But for what it's worth, I've done so much in the past two months that I don't regret it, and I've held out until the day I saw it.

I am glad that I still have the passion to do all this. If people all over the world were as foolish and innocent as me to believe in the ideals of scholars, maybe this world would not become so difficult.

I don't know. But I do know this:

Now that my country is safe, my little family is safe.

I can down-to-earth, do their own original want to do, want to learn. I chose to adapt to the disease overseas, to become a person who was trying to stay healthy because of the possibility of infection.

20 years old, seven days to 21. I'm 20 years old, and in general, I'm not famous, but I don't regret that I spent the last three months of my 20s doing something that I could be proud of for the rest of my life.

I've done what I can. I've saved lives.
